page.title: 16COPPICING CHESTNUT IN CAPEL
page.content: MANY BROADLEAVED TREES ARE USED FOR COPPICING. IN OUR PARISH WE USE SWEET CHESTNUT,IN PAST DAYS OAK,WILLOW,BEECH ASH, HORNBEAM AND ALDER WERE USED. {NOWADAYS THREE DIFFERENT KINDS OF TREE {ARE USED - HAZEL FOR HURDLES,BEAN RODS {AND THATCH PEGS,SWEET CHESTNUT FOR {POLES & FENCING AND WILLOW FOR BASKETS THE SWEET CHESTNUT IS CUT TO GROUND LEVEL, THE BRANCHES ARE REMOVED, THE BARK IS STRIPPED AND THE END IS BOILED IN TAR TO PREVENT ROTTING,THE TREES THEN START TO GROW AGAIN. IN THE NEXT 10 - 15 YEARS THEY CAN BE COPPICED AGAIN.{THE POLES ARE USEFUL IN CAPEL {FOR HOP POLES, TREE SUPPORTS, STAKES {AND CLEFT FENCING.}SWEET CHESTNUT FENCING IS SENT FROM CAPEL AS FAR AWAY AS SCOTLAND. WIDE PATHS THROUGH THE PLANTATIONS PREVENT FIRE SPREADING. BRISH BROOMS ARE USED FOR FIRE CONTROL.
